intro: Arthrochortus loliaceus, commonly known as the silverleaf flax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and slender, erect stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a cluster at the tip of each stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
